newsitem.title: UK: HSBC eases as Morgan Stanley downgrades.
newsitem.headline: HSBC eases as Morgan Stanley downgrades.

text.p: Shares in HSBC Holdings Plc eased on Friday as Morgan Stanley cut the stock to "neutral" from "outperformer" due to the recent meteoric share price rise.
Morgan Stanley analyst, Nick Collier, said the downgrade was purely to do with the recent share price performance and that his forecasts were unchanged.
"We like the fundamentals it is a lovely stock," he said.
HSBC fell 38-1/2p to 2,139p and even taking today's fall into account has risen two pounds in the last week. Last Friday the stock opened at 1,937p and ended the week at 1,961-1/2p.

Elsewhere in the banking sector National Westminster Bank gave up Thursday's gain made on the back of speculation that Prudential Corp Plc may make a bid. The stock was 18-1/2p lower at 875p after a 19-1/2p gain yesterday. Pru was 7p lower at 607p.
